title: Unborn
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

| ------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |

| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                             | [rC+](/Cold "Cold"), [rPois+++](/Poison "Poison"), [rN+++](/Negative_energy "Negative energy"), [rTorm](/Torment "Torment"), [rRot+++](/Rot "Rot"), [rDrown](/Asphyxiation "Asphyxiation"), [rWater](/Category:Water_resistance "Category:Water resistance") |

|   |                                                                                                   |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A devotee of Yredelemnul that has committed to eternal worship and servitude — even beyond death. |

**Unborn** are [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul")-worshiping [liches](/Lich "Lich") whose spell set focuses entirely on powerful [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy"). They also possess the ability to [reflect damage](/Injury_Mirror "Injury Mirror") you inflict upon them back at you. They can be found in [the Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt"), [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss"), and [the Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths").

## Spells

| Spell set |                                                        |                                                     |
| :-------- | ------------------------------------------------------ | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1     | [Agony](/Agony "Agony")                                | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2     | [Dispel Undead](/Dispel_Undead "Dispel Undead") (3d19) | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3     | [Injury Mirror](/Injury_Mirror "Injury Mirror")        | [Priest flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot4     | [Animate Dead](/Animate_Dead "Animate Dead")           | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot5     | [Haunt](/Haunt "Haunt")                                | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Living characters facing unborn should definitely bring at least one rank of [life protection](/Life_protection "Life protection") to negate Agony. Undead characters can rely on summoned hordes to block the line of fire necessary for Dispel Undead to hit you. A few shots of [Abjuration](/Abjuration "Abjuration") can exorcise whatever horrible things Haunt surrounds you with. In the end, though, Mirror Damage is still the most dangerous spell they possess.
- As with the [deep dwarf death knight](/Deep_dwarf_death_knight "Deep dwarf death knight"), when an unborn "kneels in prayer and is bathed in unholy energy," that means it has activated Mirror Damage. In the console game, its glyph will change from a steady brown L to an alternating purple L and grey L. Tiles players should look for a little red arrow icon. You can also see if Mirror Damage is active by e**[x](/X "X")**amining the unborn to see if it is "reflecting injuries." The spell lasts approximately 20 turns.
- When an unborn is reflecting damage, do not hit it with any big [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations"). Even if it isn't reflecting damage, don't use any massive multi-turn spells like [Ice Storm](/Ice_Storm "Ice Storm"), [Fire Storm](/Fire_Storm "Fire Storm"), or [Tornado](/Tornado "Tornado"), as it may turn on reflection halfway through the spell. Instead, snipe at it while it is not reflecting, or use summons to take it out.

## History

- Unborn were merged into human [death knights](/Death_knight "Death knight") in [0.17](/0.17 "0.17").
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), this monster was known as an [unborn deep dwarf](/Unborn_deep_dwarf "Unborn deep dwarf") and could be found in [deep dwarven](/List_of_deep_dwarves "List of deep dwarves") bands. Like all deep dwarves, they did not regenerate.
html:
Unborn

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
unborn L 
HP 62-90
HD 11
XP 1171
Speed 10
AC 2
EV 10
Will Immune
Attack1 17 (hit: plain)


Resistances rC+, rPois+++,
rN+++, rTorm,
rRot+++, rDrown,
rWater
Vulnerabilities Holy, Holy wrath
Habitat Land
Intelligence High
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Undead
Size Medium
Type unborn, unborn
Flags Evil
Speaks
A devotee of Yredelemnul that has committed to eternal worship and servitude — even beyond death.

Unborn are Yredelemnul-worshiping liches whose spell set focuses entirely on powerful Necromancy. They also possess the ability to reflect damage you inflict upon them back at you. They can be found in the Crypt, the Abyss, and the Depths.

Spells

Spell set
Slot1 Agony Wizard flag
Slot2 Dispel Undead (3d19) Wizard flag
Slot3 Injury Mirror Priest flag
Slot4 Animate Dead Wizard flag
Slot5 Haunt Wizard flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Living characters facing unborn should definitely bring at least one rank of life protection to negate Agony. Undead characters can rely on summoned hordes to block the line of fire necessary for Dispel Undead to hit you. A few shots of Abjuration can exorcise whatever horrible things Haunt surrounds you with. In the end, though, Mirror Damage is still the most dangerous spell they possess.
  • As with the deep dwarf death knight, when an unborn "kneels in prayer and is bathed in unholy energy," that means it has activated Mirror Damage. In the console game, its glyph will change from a steady brown L to an alternating purple L and grey L. Tiles players should look for a little red arrow icon. You can also see if Mirror Damage is active by examining the unborn to see if it is "reflecting injuries." The spell lasts approximately 20 turns.
  • When an unborn is reflecting damage, do not hit it with any big Conjurations. Even if it isn't reflecting damage, don't use any massive multi-turn spells like Ice Storm, Fire Storm, or Tornado, as it may turn on reflection halfway through the spell. Instead, snipe at it while it is not reflecting, or use summons to take it out.

History

  • Unborn were merged into human death knights in 0.17.
  • Prior to 0.13, this monster was known as an unborn deep dwarf and could be found in deep dwarven bands. Like all deep dwarves, they did not regenerate.
